reviewText:
Product received for free

A cross between Puddle and marble tilt games.

You tilt the playfield to move bits of liquid through color changing symbols, through static and moving pieces, and into color coded vial symbols, while avoiding falling into hole symbols or off of the playfield.

This may seem awfully mundane and straightforward, but it's actually quite challenging, varied, and at times clever - although at times it can feel pointlessly frustrating too.

The fluid physics simulation works quite nicely (as in gameplay, not realism), and the controls (using an analog stick, at least) feel, uh, fluid...

It held my attention for an hour and a half until I got tired of the game's last few levels, which are very hard. Then there's also an achievement for finishing 50 of the 60 levels under the lowest par time, which is also very, very hard.

Overall, this simple but challenging physics puzzle is worth at least an hour of your time.

reviewText:
Point of this game is a mixing of fluids.
In total, you must right mix the fluids and move them to the exit.
Game has realistic physics of fluids (I think).
At first, the game seems boring, but after first location begin more complex puzzles and obstacles.
A lot of moving obstacles appears after the second location.
The game has a little content, so the game can be relate, to time killer" genre.

P.S. I'm not a native speaker so sorry for mistakes.


Pros:
- cheap
- there are cards and achievements
- interesting concept
- well done fluids physics
- a large number of levels
- nice OST

Cons:
- single OST
- little story
- it is impossible to kill anyone
"

reviewText: Its a really nice game to pass the time, some levels are challenging at first but really easy when you come back later. Some things seem rather unpolished yet, such as some walls having holes through which the fluid can slip on accident with it hits the wall with too much force. When I start the game I get a CMD-like window that doesn't disappear until I exit the game, but on fullscreen it is unnoticable. Further, there seems to be no IG-sound - at least not for me, maybe something is wrong with my files. However, these are minor inconveniences that don't really influence the overall game experience.\nThe overall functionality of moving the board to guide the fluid works really well, and the level design is fun and challenging, although once you know what needs to be done, rushing through the levels to gain crystals is easy. I'd have wished for some more text guidance in the beginning, some explaination what each Wizard wants to teach me or any sort of background story. At the moment, finding your way around the beginning stage of the game seems more trial and error. However, for its price its a good enough game and I thoroughly enjoyed it :)

reviewText:
Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam group
Disclaimer: The copy of this game was provided by the developer for review purposes, yet it doesn't affect my review in any way.

Few words about the game
Colours of Magic: Aqua Teeter - A fun and entertaining puzzle game, where your goal is to lead liquid to right elixir. Sounds easy? Wait a few levels, it gets challenging after a while.

Advantages
Nice concept of the game overall
Creative levels
Realistic physics of your potion
Pleasant hand-drawn graphics
Very low price for fun content
Achievements and cards are nice bonus
Disadvantages
Soundtrack could be more developed
Buggy here and there - after minimization graphics sometimes get bugged (http://prnt.sc/ay841h), can't turn on sounds after turning them off
Summary
It's a fun game in its simplicity. For people complaining that there's a low ammount of content or anything like that - it was designed this way, to be a nice and little game to play for a while and have fun. There's quite a lot of levels with a variety of difficulties, so it's totally enough to spend few good hours in the game to pass it. In my opinion, it'd be very nice if mouse control would be added. Luckily, it's not heavily bugged game, so I can sincerely say that it was a pleasure to play it. The only thing that could be upgraded is a soundtrack, but it's a minor thing - except that, I totally recommend this game for what it is.

Personal score
8.5 / 10
If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow Opium Pulses curator page right here for more reviewed games!

reviewText: What can I say about this game? Well it starts off SUPER easy, at first I thought wow have I unintentionally purachsed a game intended for 5 year olds? All I had to do was guide a droplet of water through a colour and into the goal, it was a piece of cake! But I was wrong, after quickly running through the first few levels feeling very smug about how good I was at a game I was sure was meant for children it suddenly progressed to a level beyond diffcult when I had to start seperating the water droplet into 3 or more droplets and simultaneously juggle them all into the right colours and corresponding goals. That's when I got angry. That's when my cat ran out of the house and down the street, that's when my family huddled together in the basement and bolted the door, they knew what was coming. The fiery gamers rage within me had once again been ignited by a Steam game and no one was safe.

reviewText:
This game seems unfnished to me. It really does. Everythings functional, but theres not much there to hold my attention. There's this weird theme going on with the wizard that appears in the menu and such that never gets explained. There's only one music track and its very generic and forgettable. I know that this was originally a mobile game but I don't get why it's being sold on steam.

Pros:
+ Fully functional
+ Concept seems interesting

Cons:
- Only one music track
- Boring
- Little story and nothing is explained
- When I opened the game it runs this super shade command prompt window that made my anti-virus freak out
- Spelling and grammar errors

The concept is interesting and could work as a fully fleshed out game, but it really failed to hold my attention for long. I only played 5 minutes and by then, I was already bored and regretting my purchase. So I suggest staying away from this one unless it gets fleshed out a bit more. I've already sent a refund request.

reviewText:
PRO

Game has great music
Very unique

CONS

Fluids.W7.exe has crashed    THIS HAPPENS CONSTANTLY!

Let me respond to two statements from the game's description:

- realistic fluid animation and physics;
Not really, no. Too much viscosity for water, or most other liquids for that matter. The elixirs" behave more like a gelatinous-blobby substance... thing.

This game was initially designed for devices with accelerometer but for PC we decided to add WASD and arrow controls
date: that made the game even more difficult and entertaining!\nNo
recommended: I'm quite sure that made the game easier. Which is good. I love easy games. And this game is pretty easy
hoursPlayed: although maps 2-5 and 5-5 did cause some despair. The time requirements for getting a 3-star rating in individual stages are well balanced - they cause just a little bit of frustration but are far from impossible. There's a good chance you might complete Aqua Teeter in one sitting and before cards finish dropping. There are 60 levels total but you only need to 3-star 50 of them for the most difficult achievement. I love seeing that kind of thing
voteText: it deserves praise. Good value for money

reviewText: Inexpensive casual game involving liquid physics - always tricky as liquid rarely wants to do what you want it to do. Not really diverting for long periods due to the lack of a soundtrack and the sameyness of the gameplay, but it's a $1 casual game, what do you want?

A nice little game! It's relaxing and challenging at the same time, and I really started having to think about the solution by level 12 or so. It goes quickly and is easy enough to figure out as far as gameplay is concerned.\n\nI had to go into the launch parameters and add FluidsW7.exe 1920 1080 false" to have it open in windowed mode
date: which was more work than I'm used to. But hey
recommended: it worked! Now if only the sound would turn back on..."

reviewText: This game is fun for a casual game. It can get a bit difficult to separate the water without mixing the colors. Overall it is fun in small doses.
